text.section:
Each individual whom the State, a county, or a local government appoints or employs as a heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration inspector shall:
each year attend a continuing education course that the Board or, with the approval of the Board, a county or local government conducts; and
meet minimum standards that are:
established by the Board; and
administered:
for a county or local government inspector, by the county or local government that appoints or employs the inspectors; and
for a State inspector by the State.

An individual may not have any financial interest in any business that provides heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, or refrigeration services while employed by the State, a county, or any local government as a heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration inspector.

section.section: On appointment or employment, the individual shall place any license that the inspector holds on inactive status subject to § 9A-309 of this title.
The Board may issue a heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration inspector identification card to an inspector who has placed the appropriate licensee on inactive status.

On termination of the appointment or employment of an individual as a heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration inspector, the Board shall reactivate the license of the individual who is on inactive status, without examination, if the individual:
makes a written request to the Board; and
pays to the Board a reactivation fee established by the Board.
